ARABIC: قُلْ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَآؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَن يَأْتِيكُم بِمَآءٍ مَّعِينٍۭ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Say: 'What do you think? If, one morning, your water disappears into the earth who will bring you running water?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Say: "Just think: If your water were to dry up in the morning who will bring you water from a fresh, flowing stream?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Say to them: “Did you even consider: if all the water that you have (in the wells) were to sink down into the depths of the earth, who will produce for you clear, flowing water?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Say, "Have you not thought that if your water was to dry up, who would bring you water from the spring?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Say, “What is your opinion – if in the morning all your water were to sink into the earth, then who is such who can bring you water flowing before you?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Say: "Tell me! If (all) your water were to sink away, who then can supply you with flowing water"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Say: Have you considered if your water should go down, who is it then that will bring you flowing water?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say: 'What think you? If in the morning your water should have vanished into the earth, then who would bring you running water?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Say: Have ye thought: If (all) your water were to disappear into the earth, who then could bring you gushing water?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Say, "Have you considered if your water were to sink  into the ground, who could then bring you flowing water?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Say thou: bethink ye, were your water to be sunk away, who then could bring you water welling-up?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Say, ‘Tell me, should your water sink down [into the ground], who will bring you running water?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Say: "See ye?- If your stream be some morning lost (in the underground earth), who then can supply you with clear-flowing water?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Tell me! If (all) your water were to be sunk away, who then can supply you with flowing (spring) water?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Say: 'What do you think. If your water should sink into the earth in the morning, who then would bring you running water'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Say, “Have you considered? If your water drains away, who will bring you pure running water?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [67:30]   Say: ‘Have you considered: If your water were to sink deep into the earth, who then will bring you running water?’, which hands and buckets would be able to reach, like [they do] your water: in other words, none but God, exalted be He, would be able to bring it, so how can you reject that He will resurrect you? It is commendable for one to say Allāhu rabbu’l-‘ālamīna, ‘God, Lord of the Worlds!’, after ma‘īn, ‘running water’, as is stated in a hadīth. This verse was recited before a certain tyrant who then replied, ‘Hatchets and pickaxes will bring it!’, whereupon the water of his eyes dried up and he became blind. We seek refuge with God against that we should be insolent towards Him or His verses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Say) to them, Muhammad: (Have ye thought) people of Mecca: (If (all) your water) i.e. Zamzam (were to disappear into the earth) out of your reach, (who then could bring you gushing water) within your reach? It is also said that this means: who could bring you gushing water save the Creator of the whale and the pen'. And of the surah in which Nun is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 52 verses, 300 words and 1,256 letters: Surah 68: The Pen (al-Qalam) And of the surah in which Nun is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 52 verses, 300 words and 1,256 letters:
